Literature Information.Literature: There are two cysteine-derived thiazole groups. This peptide is not secreted. T. erythraeum crude methanolic extracts were tested for general cytotoxicity (HCT-116 at 10 ug/ml and CEM-TART at 5 and 50 ug/ml) and anti-human immunodeficiency virus (1 and 10 ug/ml), antifungal (Candida albicans at 10 ug/ml), or antimicrobial (Staphylococcus aureus and Enterococcus faecium at 10 ug/ml) effects. No significant activity was found in these assays (data not shown). To be replaced.
Literature Information.Author: Sudek S, Haygood MG, Youssef DT, Schmidt EW. 2006
Literature Information.Title: Structure of trichamide, a cyclic peptide from the bloom-forming cyanobacterium Trichodesmium erythraeum, predicted from the genome sequence.
